The DOD molecule connects to the PROG molecule in the co-crystal structure in a way which is similar to the 4-HBA-PROG. In this case, the stoichiometric ratio of the molecular structure is 2:1 and the homo-molecular dimers of 4-HBA self-assemble via

strong hydrogen bonds, which results in a linear co-crystal unit [ 8]. Similarly, Weyna and co-workers have reported that the DOD molecule co-crystallizes with linear bipyridyl compounds and adopts a zipper-type structure [ 18]. These examples show that a linear CCF can enhance the possibilities to predict the structure of the co-crystals.
